characters.story: "TAN!" the shells sing cheerfully - being greedy, to covet and desire!
"Chin?" the jewels question curiously - is it a stringed instrument, a zither for music?
"LEE!" the old west tree commands sharply - the chestnut nut and kernel!
"Tan?" the water and sunflower question curiously in the old west - is this a deep pool, a frigid cave for rabbits?
"CHYEN!" the road sings cheerfully - time to resituate, relocate to Taiwan!
"FOO!" he commands sharply - to overturn, topple and reverse!
"PYAO!" the food sings cheerfully - to flutter, float and drift!
The gate bends down drooping - the boss, the owner and manager!
"KWOH!" the gate and lively command sharply - broad, wide and spacious!
"BEE!" the gate commands sharply - close, shut and seal!
"RWUN!" the water commands sharply - to moisten, wet and lubricate!
"Guh?" the gate questions curiously - is this a cabinet, a pavilion in the loft?
"GUH!" the fingers and cabinet sing cheerfully - to put aside, but don't waste time!
The gate and list bend down drooping - to explicate, clarify and expound!
"YWEH!" the gate commands sharply - to peruse, read and inspect!
"MUN!" the heart and gate command sharply - stuffy, silent and stifling!
The gate bends down drooping - a flash of lightning, dodge!
"Fah?" the gate questions curiously - is it a valve for the honorable family to control?
